question: How does the rendering engine of a web browser process and render an HTML document, and how do the concepts of the DOM, CSSOM, and the render tree contribute to this process?
options: The browser parses HTML into a DOM tree and CSS into a CSSOM tree, then combines them into a render tree.
HTML is directly converted into pixels without any intermediary steps.
JavaScript executes before the HTML is parsed to construct the final page layout.
The browser first loads all images and scripts before rendering any part of the page.
answer: The browser parses HTML into a DOM tree and CSS into a CSSOM tree, then combines them into a render tree.

question: Which rendering approach is most suitable for improving SEO and initial load performance in web applications?
What is the primary purpose of the 'defer' attribute in a script tag?
options: To execute the script before the HTML parsing starts
To delay script execution until after the entire document is parsed
To load scripts in parallel but execute them immediately
To prevent the script from running
answer: To delay script execution until after the entire document is parsed

question: Which of the following is NOT a valid value for the 'rel' attribute in a <link> tag?
What happens if multiple meta tags for viewport settings are used in an HTML document?
options: Only the first meta viewport tag is applied
All meta viewport tags are merged
The last meta viewport tag takes precedence
answer: The last meta viewport tag takes precedence

question: What is the difference between 'async' and 'defer' attributes in script tags?
options: Both execute scripts in order but after HTML parsing
Async loads scripts in parallel and executes immediately, while defer waits until HTML parsing is complete
Defer loads scripts immediately but executes them later, async does not
There is no difference; both attributes function the same way
answer: Async loads scripts in parallel and executes immediately, while defer waits until HTML parsing is complete

question: What is the default display property of an <input> element?
Which of the following is NOT a valid HTML5 semantic element?
What happens if an HTML document does not include a <!DOCTYPE> declaration?
options: The page will not be rendered at all
The browser will switch to quirks mode
The document will be invalid and rejected by the browser
The page will load but with incorrect colors
answer: The browser will switch to quirks mode

question: What is the purpose of the 'sandbox' attribute in an <iframe>?
options: To provide a secure environment restricting iframe behavior
To disable all styles in the iframe
answer: To provide a secure environment restricting iframe behavior

question: Which HTML element is used to define an interactive component in HTML5?
Which of the following elements can be used to define a client-side image map?
What is the purpose of the 'autocomplete' attribute in an <input> field?
options: To allow auto-filling based on previous user input
To prevent users from entering incorrect data
To limit the number of characters entered
answer: To allow auto-filling based on previous user input

question: Which HTTP status code is returned when an HTML page is successfully loaded?
What is the primary function of the <noscript> tag in HTML?
options: To define a fallback for users with disabled JavaScript
To execute scripts that run without JavaScript
To prevent all scripts from running
answer: To define a fallback for users with disabled JavaScript

question: Which of the following HTML elements is used for defining metadata?
Which attribute is required in an tag for accessibility?
Which event attribute is used to execute JavaScript when an element loses focus?
Which of the following best describes 'lazy loading' in HTML?
options: It delays the loading of resources until they are needed
It preloads all images and scripts for faster rendering
It removes unnecessary elements from the page
It loads all content at once to prevent flickering
answer: It delays the loading of resources until they are needed

question: Which HTML attribute is used to specify a media query in a <link> tag?
What is the sum of the interior angles of a hexagon?
If a car travels at a speed of 60 km/h for 2.5 hours, how far does it travel?
What is the value of 7! (7 factorial)?
If x² - 9 = 0, what are the possible values of x?
A triangle has angles of 35° and 75°. What is the measure of the third angle?
What is the square root of 256?
If 5x + 3 = 18, what is the value of x?
What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 6, 12, 20, ...?
What is the area of a circle with a radius of 7 cm? (Use π = 3.14)
What is 2/3 of 120?
The sum of two numbers is 90, and their difference is 30. What is the larger number?
What is the perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 5 cm?
If a number is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%, what is the net effect?
What is the cube root of 64?
What is the sum of the first 10 natural numbers?
Which number is a prime number?
If the average of five numbers is 48, what is their total sum?
A shopkeeper buys a product for $80 and sells it for $100. What is the profit percentage?
If 9a = 81, what is the value of a?
A train moves at a speed of 90 km/h. How long will it take to cover 450 km?
Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
Which CSS property is used to make text bold?
What is the default position of an HTML element?
Which CSS property controls the space between lines of text?
Which CSS property is used to set the background image of an element?
Which property is used to set the width of an element’s border?
What value of the position property places an element relative to its normal position?
Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the parent element?
Which CSS property is used to make an element disappear but still occupy space?
Which CSS property is used to apply shadow to text?
Which of the following is NOT a valid CSS border style?
Which CSS property is used to control the order of flexible items?
Which CSS property is used to make a website responsive?
Which CSS property is used to add space between elements' content and their border?
Which CSS property allows text to wrap around floating elements?
What is the correct syntax for a CSS comment?
Which CSS property is used to create an animation?
Which CSS property defines the transition effect?
Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners?
Which CSS property is used to specify how an element should be displayed when its content overflows?
Which city is known as the 'Pink City' of Rajasthan?
Which is the largest district of Rajasthan by area?
Which fort in Rajasthan is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is known as the 'Golden Fort'?
Which desert is located in Rajasthan?
Which is the official state animal of Rajasthan?
Which is the longest river in Rajasthan?
Who was the founder of the city of Jaipur?
Which is the highest peak in Rajasthan?
Which festival in Rajasthan is dedicated to camels?
Which city in Rajasthan is known as the 'City of Lakes'?
Which famous battle took place between Maharana Pratap and Akbar's forces in 1576?
Which dynasty ruled over Mewar before the British took control?
Which is the state flower of Rajasthan?
Which Rajasthan city is famous for its blue-colored houses?
Who is known as the 'Desert Fox of Rajasthan'?
Which Rajasthan city is known for its marble industry?
Which is the only hill station in Rajasthan?
Which of these is a famous folk dance of Rajasthan?
Which Rajasthan fort has the largest wall in the world after the Great Wall of China?
Which is the largest tiger reserve in Rajasthan?
